description.narrative: The Program will support the fiscal adjustment necessary for Mongolia's economic stabilization program and help to ensure that the budget for social sectors expenditures remains adequate. The Program will protect the poor during the financial crisis by implementing a set of policy measures in the social welfare, health, and education sectors to provide essential social services, and to initiate longer-term reforms to improve the targeting of social assistance and living conditions of the poor, especially in ger areas of Ulaanbaatar.

20% of students in 2011 continue to receive free textbooks and are targeted through PMT (sex disaggregated)

description.narrative: Pro-poor funding of priority basic services ensured

title.narrative: The benefit level of the Child Money Program per child in 2011 for the lowest socio-economic quintile, at minimum, remains equal to its 2008 level in real terms

title.narrative: Capitation rates in 2011 for Familiy Group Practitioners and Soum Health Clinics remain at least equal to the 2008 level in real terms
